sentence.Network_en: Most of the stories about him are apocryphal.
sentence.Network_cn: 关于他的传闻多属虚构。

sentence.Network_en: Most of the story about his private life was probably apocryphal.
sentence.Network_cn: 有关他私生活的事可能大部分都是虚构的.

sentence.Network_en: The apocryphal story of Columbus and the egg is very interesting.
sentence.Network_cn: 哥伦布竖蛋这个真伪不明的故事十分有趣.

entry.tran: （指可能会说明真相的故事）真实性可疑的，虚构的，杜撰的
entry.def: An apocryphal story is one which is probably not true or did not happen, but which may give a true picture of someone or something.

example.ex: This may well be an apocryphal story...
example.tran: 这很可能是个杜撰的故事。

example.ex: There is a story, probably apocryphal, about a British motorcyclist on holiday in America.
example.tran: 故事讲述一位英国摩托车手在美国度假，但未必真实。

stems_affixes.word_buile: apocrypha[n.伪经,伪书]+al……的→adj.伪经的,假冒的
crypt秘密,隐藏+ic……的→adj.秘密的,神秘的
apo离开+crypha=crypt神秘,神圣→离开神圣→伪经
crypto=crypt秘密,隐藏+gram图,码,字→秘密字→密码
crypt秘密,隐藏+onym名字→n.匿名,假名
de去掉+crypt秘密,隐藏→v.译[电文], 解释明白
en使……进入+crypt秘密,隐藏→将……加密
